resume.description: Jason is an experienced, self-taught Java developer with a successful track record delivering across a Full Stack of development technology within Agile and traditional project frameworks. Prior to joining Booz Allen, Jason worked at the Community College of Baltimore County. During the first year, he joined as an IT Computer Technician and then transitioned to a Developer role on a team tasked with building a Content Management System allowing faculty and staff to publish their own content to the college website. As he continued to support this system, he worked with colleagues and independently to create and enhance in-house software as well as install, configure, customize, enhance, and maintain various third-party software. He used Full Stack development technology including Java, SQL, JSP, HTML, SCSS, jQuery, XML, XSLT, and XPath. At Booz Allen, Jason supported a distributed cross-domain solution using Full Stack development technology including Java, SQL, JSP, AngularJS, Angular Materials, HTML, SCSS, jQuery, XML, XSLT, XPath, Maven, SaltStack, and Python.

notes.note: Frequently breaks programmer flow, buggy, and prone to workspace corruption.
My most favorite IDE by far!
I respect this OS the least.

description.h:p: Lead project developer for the SCRIPT web application.

h:ul.h:li: Collaborated with teams to upgrade projects, develop new features, resolve bugs, and migrate between systems.
Trained team developers on various technologies and tools throughout the Full Stack.

description.h:p: Supported various components of an Airport Surveillance system.

h:ul.h:li: Worked with team to modernize and enhance web front-end interface while maintaining legacy code.
Performed fixes, maintenance, and feature implementation on back end server code in addition to thick Java client.
Regularly participated in code reviews, and helped shape approaches to critical solutions.
Supported a distributed cross-domain solution in an Agile environment.
Regarded as team SME for SQL and web front-end (UI/UX).
Collaborated with and assisted team members with development, testing, and DevOps.

employer.name: The Community College of Baltimore County

h:ul.h:li: Integrated Banner™ SIS with Barnes & Noble's REST API to insert web UI elements that allow users to navigate to required course material.
Developed, enhanced, and maintained a custom in-house Content Management System for the college website using Java, Oracle PL/SQL, REST, HTML, CSS, jQuery, and Apache Tomcat.
Worked with a team to create a custom in-house Content Management System for the college website. After launch, was responsible for maintenance, enhancements, and new features.
Designed and developed an Apache Tomcat web application and its HTML/JavaScript front-end counterpart providing an Online Orientation experience for new students.

Designed, developed, enhanced, and maintained the entire stack for an Apache Tomcat web application interfacing with Active Directory to provide an Online Phone Directory with advanced search capabilities.
Designed and developed an interactive, reusable, and highly versatile and customizable Web Calendar designed to consume event data in custom XML schemas using JSP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.

Developed, enhanced, and maintained the entire stack for an Apache Tomcat web application interfacing with Active Directory, Oracle DBMS, and Microsoft SQL Server to provide Technical Support personnel with indispensable information dashboards and tools that they can use to manage and troubleshoot account issues.
Designed and developed a Java CLI which uses XML, XSLT, and XPath to consume a third-party REST API and automate the importing, processing, and exporting of Academic Catalog information.

Designed, developed, enhanced, and maintained the entire stack for an Apache Tomcat web application interfacing with Active Directory and Oracle DBMS to provide students a way to recover their account and reset their password.
Installed, configured, customized, augmented, and maintained a third-party multi-tier Event Scheduling software package using JavaScript, jQuery, jQuery UI, HTML, CSS, XSLT, XPath, and SQL.

description.h:p: Integrated Banner™ SIS with Barnes & Noble's REST API to insert web UI elements allowing users to navigate to required course material.

h:ul.h:li: Using PL/SQL in an Oracle database, created custom bookstore API and modified existing Banner™ packages to use it.
Designed custom API to be as flexible and versatile as possible, allowing links to be generated from any number of courses.

Because Barnes & Noble's REST API responds only to POST requests, an embedded form was required, causing the inherent limitation that the generated button/link could not be nested anywhere inside an existing form (which was most places). I overcame this limitation using jQuery.

description.h:p: Created a Java CLI solution from scratch to streamline and automate the importing, processing, and exporting of Academic Catalog information for use on the college website.

h:ul.h:li: Interfaced with third-party REST API to import XML data, splitting requested data into smaller chunks to avoid HTTP timeouts.
Applied custom XSL Transform to produce final XML.
Allowed for customization of output format, and processing rules/logic via an XML properties file.

description.h:p: Sole lead for installation, configuration, customization, and augmentation of third-party event scheduling software package.

h:ul.h:li: Augmented WebViewer's HTML template files using jQuery, jQuery UI, and AJAX, adding new capabilities and features unavailable in the original product.

Created a page from scratch that relied heavily on Web Services, AJAX, jQuery, and jQuery UI. This page enabled users to search for spaces matching a wide variety of criteria, and check the availability for specific dates/times before scheduling an event in that space.
Collected and associated latitude/longitude data with all spaces defined in system, then integrated with Google Maps to show location of space and allow for 1-click access to directions.

description.h:p: Sole lead creating a mobile-friendly Apache Tomcat web application used by students to retrieve their account information and/or reset their password.

h:ul.h:li: Used jQuery, jQuery UI, and jQuery Mobile to deliver a Responsive experience.

description.h:p: Sole lead creating an Apache Tomcat web application, used by 100+ support personnel to manage and troubleshoot over 800,000 user accounts, that interfaced with Oracle DBMS, Microsoft SQL Server, and Active Directory to consolidate support functions in one place.

h:ul.h:li: Integrated with Active Directory for authentication and group membership authorization.

description.h:p: Used during the student application process to verify submitted street addresses' location inside or outside county boundaries.

h:ul.h:li: Created from scratch a standalone Java command-line application, the PL/SQL package, and Java code within the Oracle database.

description.h:p: Built from scratch an interactive, highly customizable user-facing web calendar displaying college event data loaded from custom XML schemas.
description.h:div: Another project, jFormat (a formatting API), was born from this effort, written in JavaScript for highly versatile text, date, and number formatting.

h:ul.h:li: Tokens are expressed in the form of ${object.property#format(arg1, arg2)}.
Date objects can be formatted using most of the patterns available for use by the Java class SimpleDateFormat.

description.h:p: Sole lead creating from scratch an interactive, searchable phone directory, backed by Active Directory, and running on Apache Tomcat.

h:ul.h:li: Created supplemental Java CLI that used the Java Excel API to generate and publish a downloadable spreadsheet containing the entire phone directory. Also configured CRON to automate its execution.
Designed Web UI to provide Simple and Advanced search modes, with advanced mode allowing a combination of multiple user-specified criteria with an advanced set of comparators.

description.h:p: Java EE Web Application and its HTML/JavaScript front-end counterpart providing an online orientation for new students.

h:ul.h:li: Includes custom-developed supporting Oracle database schema and all tables, views, triggers, sequences, etc.
Integrates with Active Directory for authentication and group membership authorization.

Administration portal built with jQuery and jQuery UI allows authorized academic advisors to customize the orientation pages and assessments, track student progress, and manage the list of authorized advisors.

description.h:p: Robust Java CLI tool for managing language strings for a proprietary online virtual learning environment (WebCT).

h:ul.h:li: Applies a compiled set of preferred language strings to a WAR file.
Provided options to search for text to change, making the initial compilation process much easier.

description.h:p: Worked with a team to create a custom in-house Content Management System and its various UI components for the college website. After launch, responsibilities included maintenance, enhancements, and new features.

h:ul.h:li: Sole developer of Java Applet (Swing) WYSIWYG HTML Editor with Dreamweaver-like capabilities.
Implemented powerful table-specific editor dialogs for inserting/modifying tables, splitting/merging rows, columns, and cells with features lacking from Dreamweaver.
Created from scratch a custom Spellchecker service (powered by Aspell on back-end) supporting global and per-user dictionaries.
Developed a custom Win32 installer using NSIS (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System) for end-user installation of files necessary for certain features of the HTML Editor Java Applet.
Troubleshot/repaired hardware and software issues over the phone and in the field.
Installed network cables, troubleshot network connectivity, and activated Ethernet wall ports across campus; upgraded hardware and software in computer labs.
Created Microsoft Access Database, Forms, and accompanying VBA code to facilitate technical support by Help Desk personnel.
